mim.author: emagnso
mim.name: ReqRfPort
mim.description: This MO represents port on the Radio of various type depending on MOid. It represents an antenna feeder port on the Radio when it has the MOid; A, B C, etc... It represents a cross connection port on the Radio when it has the MOid; RXA_IO or RXB_IO. It represents a RET-port on the External Radio if it has the MOid; R.

structMember.name: sampleTime
structMember.description: Timestamp for the value. Format: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS.XXX

structMember.name: message
structMember.description: Message about insufficient readings above screening threshold.

enumMember.name: DISABLED
enumMember.description: The resource is totally inoperable.

enumMember.name: ENABLED
enumMember.description: The resource is partially or fully operable.

enumMember.name: LOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively prohibited from performing services for its users.

enumMember.name: UNLOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively permitted to perform services for its users. This is independent of its inherent operability.

enumMember.name: SHUTTINGDOWN
enumMember.description: Use of the resource is administratively permitted to existing instances of use only. While the system remains in the shutting down state the manager may at any time cause the managed object to revert to the locked state.

enumMember.name: ENABLED
enumMember.description: Feature support in radio is enabled.

enumMember.name: DISABLED
enumMember.description: Feature support in radio is disabled because some other feature is prioritized.

enumMember.name: NO_SUPPORT
enumMember.description: Radio can not support feature.

enumMember.name: FULL_SUPPORT
enumMember.description: Radio can fully support feature.

enumMember.name: LIMITED_SUPPORT
enumMember.description: Radio has limited support for feature because HW cannot save power on every symbol position.

enum.name: AvailStatus
enum.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value.

enumMember.name: IN_TEST
enumMember.description: The resource is undergoing a test procedure. If the administrative state is locked or shutting down, normal users are prevented from using the resource.

enumMember.name: FAILED
enumMember.description: The resource has an internal fault that prevents it from operating.

enumMember.name: POWER_OFF
enumMember.description: The resource requires power to be applied and is not powered on.

enumMember.name: OFF_LINE
enumMember.description: The resource requires a routine operation to be performed. This routine operation is to place the resource online and make it available for use. The operation may be manual or automatic, or both. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: OFF_DUTY
enumMember.description: The resource has been made inactive by an internal control process.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY
enumMember.description: The resource cannot operate because some other resource on which it depends is unavailable.

enumMember.name: DEGRADED
enumMember.description: The service available from the resource is degraded in some respect.

enumMember.name: NOT_INSTALLED
enumMember.description: The resource represented by the managed object is not present, or is incomplete.

enumMember.name: LOG_FULL
enumMember.description: Indicates a log full condition. The semantics are defined in CCITT Rec. X.735 | ISO/IEC 10164-6.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_LOCKED
enumMember.description: The administrative state of a resource that this resource depends on is locked. or the availability status of the other resource is dependency locked.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_FAILED
enumMember.description: The availability status of a resource that this resource depends on is failed or dependency failed.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_SHUTTINGDOWN
enumMember.description: The administrative state of a resource that this resource depends on is shutting down. or the availability status of the other resource is dependency shutting down.

class.name: RfPort
class.description: This MO represents a port on an Radio of various types depending on the rfPortId of the Port MO. Represents an antenna feeder port on the Radio if it has an rfPortId like A, B, C, etc. Represents a cross connection port on the Radio if it has any of the rfPortIds RXA_IO or RXB_IO. Represents a RET port on the External Radio if it has the rfPortId R.

attribute.name: rfPortId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status. It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: nodeUniqueRfPortId
attribute.description: Internal identifier for the RfPort to ease error traceability.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: vswrSupervisionActive
attribute.description: VSWR supervision status. Indicates if supervision of Voltage Standing Wave Ratio (VSWR) is enabled for the branch of this port on the Radio Unit. VSWR supervision is possible on a TX branch only.

attribute.name: vswrSupervisionSensitivity
attribute.description:
VSWR supervision sensitivity.
High values enable detection of low-reflected power (high return loss). Low values require high-reflected power (low return loss) to cause alarms.
VSWR = (1+10^(-RL/20))/(1-10^(-RL/20))
Where RL is Return Loss
Relation between sensitivity and return loss on Radio is defined as: RL = 6 + vswrSupervisionSensitivity [%]*0.08 dB
This gives VSWR=1.5 for 100% sensitivity and VSWR=3 for 1% sensitivity.
If attribute set to -1, radio chooses default return loss threshold. Currently this is the same as setting sensitivity to 1%.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state. If set to SHUTTINGDOWN, the state will immediately be brought to LOCKED.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute can cause loss of traffic.

attribute.name: vswrValue
attribute.description: VSWR value and related information from radios.

attribute.name: dlFrequencyRanges
attribute.description:
Multiple downlink frequency ranges that RfPort supports, displayed as string.
If gaps occur in supported frequency range, attribute shows multiple ranges. Lowest sub range is first.
See CPI for more information.
NOTE: For RfPort with no valid downlink frequency range, the string shows ""Not supported"".

attribute.name: ulFrequencyRanges
attribute.description:
Multiple uplink frequency ranges that RfPort supports, displayed as string.
If gaps occur in supported frequency range, attribute shows multiple ranges. Lowest sub range is first.
See CPI for more information.
NOTE: For RfPort with no valid uplink frequency range, the string shows ""Not supported"".

attribute.name: antennaSupervisionActive
attribute.description: Antenna supervision status indicates if supervision of antenna/feeder connection is enabled for the branch of this port on the Radio Unit.

attribute.name: microSleepTxRadioCapability
attribute.description: Capability in radio to support the Micro Sleep Tx functionality.

attribute.name: microSleepTxRadioStatus
attribute.description: Current status in radio of the support for the Micro Sleep Tx functionality.
